DOCNAME: CASE OF MIKULJANAC, MALISIC AND SAFAR v. SERBIA
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were dismissed from their work .
CARDINAL . On DATE they instituted civil proceedings in ORG against their former employer , seeking reinstatement and salary arrears .
CARDINAL . Sometime after the respondent ORG 's ratification of ORG , the applicants ' case was assigned to another judge .
CARDINAL . The next hearing in the case was held on DATE , when the court decided to hear several witnesses .

CARDINAL . The hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned by the judge . Subsequently , the case was yet again assigned to another judge and the next hearing was scheduled for DATE , but did not take place because the witnesses had not been duly summoned .
CARDINAL . The next hearing , scheduled for DATE , was adjourned because the summoned witnesses failed to appear .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing and heard the applicants and a witness . The applicants requested the court to obtain an additional expert opinion concerning the amount of their salary arrears . The court held CARDINAL more hearings DATE on DATE and CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered the applicants to advance the costs of the proposed expert opinion and to suggest an expert . The applicants did so on DATE . At the next hearing held on DATE , the court ordered that the expert opinion be obtained . The appointed expert submitted the opinion on DATE .
CARDINAL . The court held further hearings on DATE and DATE . The respondent then filed a request for a transfer of jurisdiction , which was dismissed by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . The court held further hearings on CARDINAL and DATE and on DATE . On the last mentioned date the court gave judgment , accepting the applicants ' claim . The applicants appealed against the decision on costs and the proceedings are currently pending before the second - instance court .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of this legislation are set out in the V.A.M. v. GPE judgment ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provided that all employment - related disputes were to be resolved by the courts within DATE from the date of institution of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . This Act entered into force on DATE and thereby repealed LAW of DATE .
CARDINAL . The text of LAW of LAW of DATE corresponds to the aforementioned LAW of DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions concerning ORG and GPE and the succession of ORG and GPE are set out in GPE judgment ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL , DATE ) .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of this Code defines “ judicial malfeasance ” ( kršenje zakona od strane sudije ) as a separate criminal offence .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW ( Ustav PERSON ) , published in ORG of GPE ( ORG - no . CARDINAL ) , provided as follows :

“ Everyone shall be entitled to compensation for any pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages suffered due to the unlawful or improper conduct of a ORG official , a ORG body or a public authority , in accordance with the law .
Such damages shall be covered by GPE or the public authority [ in question ] . ”
CARDINAL . This LAW was repealed on DATE , which is when the “ new ” LAW ( published in OG RS no . CARDINAL ) entered into force .
CARDINAL . The substance of LAW of LAW corresponds , in its relevant part , to the above - cited text of the aforementioned LAW .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the new LAW provides that a constitutional complaint may be lodged against the acts of public entities violating human and minority rights and liberties guaranteed by LAW .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW on LAW ( ORG RS CARDINAL ) provides that the election of ORG judges shall be finalised before the end of the first ORG session .
